title: What Is The Value of F

content.description: Two blocks are connected by a string with negligible mass that passes over a pulley with nonzero rotational inertia <math alttext="I" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown above. The axle of the pulley has negligible friction. The string does not slip on the pulley. Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> has mass <math alttext="4 kilograms" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mtext></mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>k</mtext><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> has mass <math alttext="6 kilograms" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>k</mtext><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. An additional force with magnitude <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is initially exerted on block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> so that the blocks do not move and is then removed.
content.question: Which of the following is most nearly the value of <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> cannot be determined without knowing the value of <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 5.5: Rotational Equilibrium and Newton's First Law in Rotational Form

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
